name: Jean Achard
introduction: Jean Achard (born Jean-Jacques Grosman in Paris, France on March 15 1918  died July 14 1951 in Gvea, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil) was a French journalist and racing driver who competed in several pre-championship events in the mid-1940s.  His only entry in the Formula 1 Championship was in the 1951 Indianapolis 500, where he failed to attend.
